title: Are there any things in mathematics that seem like they would be obviously true, but actually haven't been proven yet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are there any things in mathematics that seem like they would be obviously true, but actually haven't been proven yet? Yes. Every proof begins with acceptance of some things that will never be proved. They are called axioms. Originally, “obviously true” was part of the definition of the word axiom. An axiom had to be in controversial enough to be accepted unanimously. That is the only way that an argument based on axioms could be irrefutable. It has since been recognized that very few axioms are accepted by all without controversy. Even axioms of Euclidean geometry have been successfully challenged. Today, an axiom is only to be accepted tentatively; every truth derived from it conditional. This is probably the main reason that scientific predictions derived from a mathematical model should not be accepted until confirmed by experiment.

Here are five simple ones. Is there an infinite number of perfect numbers, i.e. the sum of the divisors sums to twice the number. For example, 12=1+2+3+6 = 2*6, 56=1+2+4+7+14+28=2*28. Thus 6 and 28 are perfect.Is there any odd perfect number? Warning: It has been proved it must be greater than 10^50. Big!Is there an infinite number of Mersenne primes. Primes of the form 2^n-1, where n is an integer. If so, there are an infinite number of perfect numbers by the Euclid-Euler theorem.Goldbach Conjecture. Every even number can be written as the sum of two primes. (So easy to state but really difficult.) Examples. 12=7+5, 24=11+13. This conjecture has been proved to the limits of current computers.Twin primes conjecture. Is there an infinite number of twin primes? This means for a given prime then adding two gives another prime. Examples. 11,13; 29,31… Difficult.Proving any of these would make you instantly world famous. All are believed to be true.

Gauss’ conjecture “ I am coming ever more to the conviction that the necessity of our geometry cannot be proved, at least not by human comprehension nor for human comprehension.” Gauss to Olbers Goettingen, 28 April 1817 This is a true statement which only a few humans have understood. Failure to understand this has lead to innumerable forks in the road in mathematics and the sciences ever since. Space is a mathematical error with no scientific evidence. It is as old as mathematics.
